document.title: WIDA English Language Development Standards Framework, 2020 Edition Kindergarten—Grade 12

7A2AB69D67884FCEA3D3CD7E12DF8EB9.description:
Show relationships between claims
with reasons and multiple sources of
evidence

B4020EE804BF4E7999D0787092DFFA36.description:
Select relevant information to support
claims with evidence from multiple
sources

0A43689881B648C3B88A02FCD36A1A86.description:
Evaluating point of view and credibility of
source, based on distinctions between fact
and opinion

A768BA8795294458B3B3A203FACB0474.description:
Analyzing relevant information from multiple
sources to develop claims in response to
compelling questions

DA7424C96C5147B7A97C2C7BCEFBC987.description:
Identifying topic and purpose (argue in favor
or against a position, present a balanced
interpretation, challenge perspective)

791DBBE1D33041CEB196E44DCC0D2C83.description:
Generalize probable causes and effects of
developments or events

98558E8F76FA465DA2A802525FAF899F.description:
Describe components, order, causes and
effects, or cycles using relevant examples
and details

1AB71DAF4BA1465B8CFBAF33CB29753F.description:
Evaluating disciplinary concepts and ideas
that are open to different interpretations

8B3EBDF4A6E54DDF9AC982BE6EEFAD0A.description:
Analyzing sources for a series of
contributing factors or causes

15C51B8EE6D24E5E85D4211AE18642A0.description:
Determining different opinions in sources
for answering compelling and supporting
questions about phenomena or events

EDB7CE95316B4416A9DF489B712FBC14.description:
Signal logical relationships among reasoning,
relevant evidence, data, and/or a model when
making a claim

0A90373FB486423480B2111CCB31FA30.description: Establish a neutral tone or an objective stance

01CAC9D2883A4CD299DC5D7D1B6DE618.description:
Make and define a claim based on evidence,
data, and/or model

FD2C1FEB3EA7485788ABC59E23D3B26D.description:
Introduce topic/phenomenon in issues
related to the natural and designed world(s)

BE0CAC2E525F4ED9AC19653C950D5769.description:
Distinguishing among facts, reasoned
judgment based on research findings,
and speculation in an explanation

40D3895408974C34A7A1AAAC40329AEC.description:
Comparing reasoning and claims based
on evidence

DEF903B155E9422798EBADA284A0224F.description:
Identifying relevant evidence from
data, models, and/or information from
investigations of phenomena or design
solutions

5C60CA42C7274E4683BBB7D7BA96714E.description:
Summarize and/or compare multiple solutions
to a problem based on how well they meet
the criteria and constraints of the design
solution

B298140AC11F4BECAE2CADC94BF6152D.description:
Develop reasoning to show relationships
between evidence and claims

94B2CEB4F4514076AF5F26EEC411586B.description:
Establish neutral or objective stance in
communicating results

7C26C4CB8C7F4937A6A70A037D02ACB3.description:
Describe observations and/or data about a
phenomenon

CD59865C4270470CBC8F2B9565BC51C0.description:
Identifying evidence that supports
particular points in an explanation

FF7D88ACC5344857B85DE2B05B99BB8B.description:
Obtaining and combining evidence and
information to help explain how or why a
phenomenon occurs

768F5FC99FFE427C814CC8D86E41F15F.description:
Defining investigable questions or
design problems based on observations,
data, and prior knowledge about a
phenomenon

C68688B2CFE94E55B01872841F940C3E.description: Justify conclusions with patterns or rules

EF5BBB4258A4426A8F7C3622655F3AA6.description:
Generalize commonalities and differences
across cases

1B20252E445A43C28A44F353332EBD10.description:
Create conjecture using definitions, patterns,
and rules

70F1FD0CFA7448349C1534F83D3C3AB8.description:
Extracting patterns or rules from solution
strategies to create generalizations

D3BB3B15FB8C458CB703ED05EC56B3D8.description:
Distinguishing commonalities and
differences among ideas in justifications

173336EA747B41C2B0C878990486FD59.description:
Comparing conjectures with patterns,
and/or rules

7A8FD3D51846440395C1FA9C9F50AD78.description: State reasoning used to generate solution

3E10B992D8E04125AC05ADD5DE672DD4.description: Describe data and/or steps to solve problem

98B6F39D1CB545E2A91CF8F8AB1F45DC.description:
Evaluating a pattern or structure that
follows a given rule

B55A1066EC3348E0961324D9D1615ED1.description:
Logically connect opinions to appropriate
evidence, facts, and details; offer a concluding
statement or section

15086D88840745478723A45413749E10.description: Support opinions with reasons and information

4CD9237B5CD847B2B1FD60C43FD5B4F2.description:
Introduce and develop a topic clearly; state an
opinion

63097EE5CF6F4ED992EA8880947F67BF.description:
Evaluating how details, reasons, and
evidence support particular points in
a text

82B8B6AB66F24ADDA2AFA28D8C931C79.description:
Analyzing points of view about the
same event or topic

0EC67E4D5CE34962BDCF453D46AEF442.description:
Develop coherence and cohesion throughout
text

A425778C297A4FD98F897776A6B2AB34.description:
Add precision and details to define, describe,
compare, and classify topic and/or entity

189324339A3040AB8E36B3ED42956156.description:
Introduce and define topic and/or entity for
audience

B7E44CA4360C48EBAB9902E9024DCA6A.description: Construct informational texts in language arts that

A4458D873F3440DF8D864450045A8270.description:
Evaluating the impact of key word
choices in a text

D8DB40A7C83940E1B2EBFE561FFC6241.description:
Analyzing details and examples for key
attributes, qualities, and characteristics

1A3F179B913B49C3AC7AD78BDB2EB7EC.description:
Identifying and summarizing main ideas
and key details

7883F66238DD4FD1A9FFB0D4AFDB9CF9.description:
Interpret informational texts in language arts
by

DF51677C68044C76BC83D841003B7E21.description:
Develop story with complication and
resolution, time and event sequences

955D63790DEB47BB807E1E245B4E60D5.description:
Develop and describe characters and
their relationships

641DA1370B5B46C8B8CBEEC22543FC6F.description:
Determining the meaning of words and
phrases used in texts, including figurative
language, such as metaphors and similes

54ABDAA3C34C436F898C4785E025C3B7.description:
Analyzing how character attributes and
actions develop across event sequences

E26C811316124A1A822F552282360813.description: Refine claims and reasoning based on new information or evidence

C18846F0D0D24206A3ACCB79F127E302.description: Evaluate changes in thinking, identifying trade-offs

386A3F2DE83945C1823540B3FA9E85E5.description: Clarify and elaborate ideas based on feedback

A2711F564C6E4D4989DDBE4B236C2669.description: Support or challenge an opinion, premise, or interpretation

944A59D38A88463AB8DE8445B0C10611.description:
Act on feedback to revise understandings of how or why something is or works in particular
ways

03550C482A334711A8614E1F56CDB62D.description:
Offer alternatives to extend or deepen awareness of factors that contribute to particular
outcomes

5BB1CC8D8FA24FE68839B76495340ED2.description: Compare changing variables, factors, and circumstances

BE978B254ABA4852A216BFB82C13FC37.description:
Follow and describe cycles and sequences of steps or procedures and their causes and
effects

C4FE81A03B9847EEB09C7D6F3E29DF34.description: Summarize most important aspects of information

D4EFBF73AD9743F5839C212C559E09C1.description: Describe the parts and wholes of a system

364439F5EE174368933FB0511F566511.description: Report on explicit and inferred characteristics, patterns, or behavior

1A5D2C457DD94337B9F9CD01589B0500.description: Create closure, recap, and offer next steps

DF16427935044CCC8DA37CCF4546244A.description: Recount and restate ideas to sustain and move dialogue forward

C4C9D95226544824AE020C893E95BD14.description: Identify and raise questions about what might be unexplained, missing, or left unsaid

CA32DCF023BF42FEBA740C066A5CC722.description: Connect stories with images and representations to add meaning

3403938A6B5E4A36AE220718308DAFFD.description: Share ideas about one’s own and others’ lived experiences and previous learning
